The funny thing about that is that it is about that in bot lane. The whole point of an ADC is to be weaker early and scale up. Any time something is put into bot lane that is strong early, it is really dangerous because of how it messes with most adc's and how easily it can do things to the enemy team's power curve. I'm not saying its bad for her to be strong early, but as an ADC, something being strong early easily converting into the enemy being strong later as well makes it a difficult game.

It's kinda stupid that Riot won't let that many champs be strong bot lane aside from Thresh, Leona and the like.  Her early strength in poke was balanced by her complete vulnerability pre-6 to ganks of pretty much any kind, as long as the lane was frozen.  Apparently only Sona's poke was oppressive, according to the Sona QQ'ers and Riot themselves, but not Lulu's or Janna's.

not that im on the "sona OP" bandwagon, but sona not being able to aim her q is irrelevant, especially in a 2v2. 

it targets the 2 closest champions in range, if there aren't champions in range it targets minions that are closest to her. 

when you are sona, and know your range, you always know what it will hit and what it wont hit before it hits. once it  selects a target, you cannot step out of range. thus you literally cannot dodge her q.

also, most of the damage is in the AA after the q.
Still, though, that said, a lot of other support champs WITH POKE can be just as oppressive.  If Sona is so bad, then why aren't things like Support Annie nerfed into the ground completely?

Because support annie has lower range, lacks sustain and mobility, and her Q is single target, with her other abilities dodgable. In addition, support annie won't deal Sona-level damage at level 1. Sona's passive basically lets her level 1 poke be just as strong as annie's level 2 poke can be with Q-W. 

I'm not saying I agree that Sona should be nerfed the way she is, quite honestly I believe that the fact that she needed to be changed the way she was showed a failure in her rework. But there is some justification for her changes.

That's only half true though.
Annie's AA range and the range of her Q are 625, which is higher (!) than the AA range of every other champ except Caitlyn. Sona's Q has a range of 850, but in order to hit her power chord, she needs to get in AA range, which is 550, thus quite a bit closer than Annie ever needs to be.
Annie's base movement speed (=mobility) is also higher than Sona's (335 vs 325) and with a single rank in her E (which few players ever take before lvl 4 or 5 anyways) Sona will only slightly exceed this value (by 3+7.5% AP, to be precise) and burns quite a bit of mana.

{{champion:37}}  has an easier time to actually land her skill on you, true. And her damage is also more sudden than that of most other champs. But she makes up for it by extreme squishiness combined with her mediocre AA range, her lack of escapes (or any other safety mechanisms such as stuns or knockbacks) and her high mana usage.
If Sona was as oppressive in lane as some people make her out to be, she would be a priority pick/ban, but her actual pick rate (7.98% in ranked, even lower in higher elos) strongly suggest the opposite.

funny how these are 2+ spells and skillshots. Lulu though has high mana costs,basically her only source of damage and is also a skillshot. They are also mostly squishy with no escapes while sona brings a 2 man heal and shield,and a move speed boost. She has an opressive lane,but is insanely useless out of it,if it weren't for her ultimate.

Sona effectively needs 3 spells for her power chord for a minimum of 135 mana (3 lvl 1 Qs) over 16 seconds or 190 mana for a W/E/Q rotation with arguably less benefits. 

Her shield costs 80 mana for 35 base strength limited to 1.5 seconds and with a pretty terrible AP ratio, which is far less than Lulu's E (80 strength/60 mana/6 seconds), Lux's W (80 strength/60 mana/3 seconds), Thresh's W (60 strength/50 mana/6 seconds) etc.
Whether or not her heal (max 45 HP) makes up for it depends on the situation. Her movement speed boost on early levels, however, barely negates her recent nerf (325+13 from her E = 338 vs 335 on many other champs) and is easily beaten by other supports such as Lulu, Blitzcrank and Janna's passive.

It is obviously hard to compare Sona to other supports due to her pretty unique and situational kit and with some decent compensation I would be perfectly fine with making Sona's Q a skillshot.
But I really can't understand why she is considered to be oppressive when most other supports can do a lot of the same if not more, given they hit their one relevant skillshot.

shes considered oppressive because she only has one (quite powerful) skillshot. Her Q poke hones into champions and if i remember correctly it resets her auto attack,while her heal helps with her being poked. Less drawbacks than leona while almost as good as annie.

"Marksman" mains.

Don't kid yourself, they are called adc mains. The title "marksman" means that they have accuracy, but since they rely on unavoidable autos they can't really say that they rely on accuracy.

The champions that should be labeled as marksmen are the ones who rely on skillshots (Varus, Ezreal, Vel'koz, Xerath, etc.)

The title "marksman" was to differentiate between melee and ranged Attack Damage Carries. I could call Master Yi an ADC just as easily as I call Caitlyn an ADC. The only reason we don't use the term "marksman" commonly anymore is due to the popularity of ranged ADCs in bot lane compared to melee carries for obvious reasons.
